oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ionic conductivity of polysiloxane-polyoxyethylene-sodium perchlorate blends
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHYAMALA, S
KULKARNI, AR
PATNI, MJ
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: oligo(oxyethylene) side-chains
salts
ionic conductivity
polysiloxane-poe and sodium-perchlorate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ion conducting polysiloxane-polyoxyethylene(POE)-sodium perchlorate(NaClO4) ternary electrolyte blends have been prepared by solution casting technique. The mole ratio of polysiloxane to POE was fixed as 5:95 and O/Na ratio was varied. The propel-ties of the polymer electrolyte complexes were studied using X-ray diffraction (XRD), Differential Scanning Calorimetry (DSC) and complex impedance analysis. Highest ambient temperature conductivity 1 x 10(-3) Omega(-1) cm(-1) was obtained at O/Na ratio=8.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 2nd National Conference on Solid State Ionics,MADRAS, INDIA,FEB 15-17, 1996
